summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVegane.l.f. Cosmetics' long-wearing Soft Glam Satin Foundation is anything but base-ic! Infused with 1% hydrating Hibiscus Complex, plus fruit extracts, this breathable liquid foundation feels as good as it looks - no caking or heaviness here, just smooth, satiny skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsLong-lasting satin finish foundation delivers medium buildable coverageBreathable formula doesn't look or feel cakeyInfused with 1% hydrating Hibiscus Complex, plus pomegranate, blueberry & goji berry extractsGreat for dry, oily & combination skinNon-comedogenic - won't clog poresAvailable in multiple shades for a wide range of skin tones100% vegan & cruelty-free, e.l.f. is Leaping Bunny Certifiede.l.f. is proud to partner with Fair Trade USA & manufacture products in Fair Trade Certified facilities; look for the Fair Trade Certified seal on your e.l.f. productKey Ingredients1% hydrating Hibiscus Complex delivers lasting hydration & targets drynessFormulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanHydroquinoneItem 2624374How To UseUsing your fave e.l.f. Foundation Brush or the Total Face Sponge (sold separately), buff and blend foundation all over face and onto the upper neck.Ingredients10 Fair Cool: Water (Aqua), Isododecane, Glycerin, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Dimethicone, Propylene Glycol, Cetyl PEG/PPG-10/1 Dimethicone, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Tridecyl Trimellitate, Sorbitan Sesquioleate, Silica, Boron Nitride, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Magnesium Stearate, Magnesium Sulfate, Phenoxyethanol, Disteardimonium Hectorite, PEG/PPG- 15/15 Dimethicone, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Diisostearyl Malate, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Aluminum Hydroxide, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Erythritol, Hibiscus Sabdariffa Extract, Butylene Glycol, Lycium Chinense Fruit Extract, Psidium Guajava Fruit Extract, Vaccinium Angustifolium (Blueberry) Fruit Extract, Hydroxyacetophenone. May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Yellow Iron Oxide (CI 77492), Red Iron Oxide (CI 77491), Black Iron Oxide (CI 77499).Ingredients may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the packaging of the product you receive for the list of ingredients in your particular product.
how_to_use: Using your fave e.l.f. Foundation Brush or the Total Face Sponge (sold separately), buff and blend foundation all over face and onto the upper neck.

reviews.headline: Finally, the perfect color !
reviews.comments: I've been looking for the exact right color of foundation for several years and finally I have found it. And I get great coverage besides.  I couldn't be happier.

reviews.headline: For sure buying again
reviews.comments: Its super lightweight and not overwhelming..very natural etty

reviews.headline: First time user, fell in loveâ€¦
reviews.comments: I went in looking for new foundation, since the one i usually buy is discontinued. Best decision, i really love the coverage and how it makes my face feel.It's lightweight and easy to apply, will continue to use from now on.

reviews.headline: Elf
reviews.comments: I tried to love this foundation. I have oily skin, it just doesnt last for me. I love that i can find a perfect color match.
I definitely do recommend this its buikdabke coverage and it looks anazing w the the halo glow liquid filter under

reviews.headline: Really goodd!!
reviews.comments: It was very smooth, no heavy feeling at all

reviews.headline: Just No
reviews.comments: Matched my skin perfectly and didn't feel heavy or greasy so I was really hoping this would work.  At application finish was very matt and gave that "made up" look.  Not at all natural.  It says its "soft glam" so I figured it would be good for nights out if not office wear. 1 hour after I put it on, MAJOR shine in t-zone and the color had turned orange-ish. Face not only looked greasy but like covered in bad spray tan.  Not a good look for glam or office.

reviews.headline: Love it < 3
reviews.comments: This foundation personally works wonders for my oily/combo skin. I have large pores and acne/textured skin, so having a natural satiny finish foundation w/o the excess oil looks and feels great for me. I also use a thin layer for my undereyes as concealer on low-effort days, which looks great too! It can also become patchy on dry, flakey spots on skin too, so be aware and stay hydrated prior. It won't work for everyone, but I love this foundation, especially for its price nowadays compared to other foundations!

reviews.headline: Flawless base
reviews.comments: I have only been able to use the elf halo glow its been the only "foundation" that stays. Until I tried this one. It's absolutely beautiful and I love that it tells you what shade to get based off the halo glow.

reviews.headline: My new favorite
reviews.comments: I have extra oily skin with texture (I used to pick my skin cus I have bad acne when I was younger). I'm very picky on foundations and this one surpirsed me. I didn't think satin works on my skin cus of how oily my skin gets. This foundation last a good 8-9 hrs which is prefect for work. When my oils do come out, it isn't alot, almost slightly dewy. It's a buildable coverage and combine with the huda beauty setting powder is the best combo. Not really a con for me but anyone else. the warm shades can lean more yellow. I have yellow/olive tone soo the shade match is a plus.

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments: It is the perfect satin foundation and at an affordable price. It covers my acne and blurred my pores without be overly matte. I am definitely going to repurchase when it runs out.

reviews.headline: Great for the price love it
reviews.comments: I was able to find my spot on match and it look so good on, it is buildable.

reviews.headline: Soft Glam Satin Foundation
reviews.comments: This is one of my favorites. I have very fair, cool toned skin and this actually matches me perfectly! It's super lightweight but very buildable to a more medium-full coverage.

reviews.headline: Great Foundation
reviews.comments: this foundation pleasantly suprised me. It gives full coverage and layers perfectly with my other products. It does oxidize after a while though, that is my one complaint

reviews.headline: this stuff is awful!!
reviews.comments: I genuinely do not understand the good reviews. This foundation is super thick and dry. It made my face feel even drier and really emphasized the texture and lines I have on my face. It also looked weird...I got the light cool shade, and it was dark and orange, and seemed to just get worse as time went on. I could not wait to get home and wash it all off!

reviews.headline: Good coverage
reviews.comments: Good coverage i like the brand

reviews.headline: foundation
reviews.comments:
It oxidizes soo bad and not good for acne porne or sensitve skin, It burned my skin so bad and just made it itchy
DO NOT recommned

reviews.headline: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.comments: I rarely wear foundation,the last product I used was a high end medium build foundation marketed for mature skin. I found this product to cover my trouble areas while also not being too cakey. It didn't settle into my smile lines nor did it oxidize thought out the day. The color match was spot on for a lower priced foundation.

reviews.headline: Oxidized darker and yellower
reviews.comments: I bought shade 23 Light Cool. It was darker and yellower than a cool shade should be. Instantly, on application, it went even darker and yellower. It's really unattractive. It feels fine on the skin. And it wears well.  My Ulta doesn't carry the fair cool shades that I would need to make this work. It is very inexpensive, but when I bought a fair cool shade replacement at another retailer, I found it was very white/chalky.  I don't recommend this foundation.  ELF should have better colorists.

reviews.headline: 5 starssss
reviews.comments: I have dry, dehydrated skin and a lot of foundations look super cakey on me but Elf killed it with this one.

faceoff_positive.comments:
Believe the hype! This foundation is beautiful! And  all the more so for it being just 8 bucks! I used the shade matcher and it gave me a good start. I recommend putting in more than 1 (if you have more than 1) shade / brand that's already a good match. The chart returned 25 Neutral or 31 Neutral fot the ones I put in. I went w/31 Neutral (I wear CN 52 Neutral in Clinique) and it is perfect. 
As I've been doing fo a couple weeks now, I used the elf putty primer just in my nose area. I used a brush to apply. I did set it w/Bye Bye Pores and I could not stop looking at it all day! It was absolutely flawless! It "wore" beautifully, even in our 110 Vegas summer heat. I did touch up just a teensy bit around my mouth myafter I ate. 
My skin looks flawless and it looks and feels like my skin but better. Really! I'm truly stunned at this elf soft glam satin foundation!
faceoff_positive.headline: Wow! Believe the hype!

faceoff_negative.comments: During application, I noticed it immediately setting into the creases of my under eye area. After 4 hours of wear in a cold office, it wasn't just patchy. There were large spots missing foundation. I do have texture on my forehead, which got the worst of it, but everywhere else was also ruined. Besides the look, it made my skin feel dry while also still being satin-y enough to slide around my skin even after setting. I suppose it *feels* like satin but definitely doesn't look like it. Maybe someone with normal/oily skin could make this work, but the only other foundations that have similar reactions are the super matte finish ones.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not For Dry Skin
